intro: Scolopia oldhamii, commonly known as Oldham's scolopia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a rough texture and a waxy coating. Scolopia oldhamii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or desert environments.
